Actual images of experiments, physical processes, convey a truth about neuroscience that words don't.

This segment shows the predictions of where a mouse is according to the recordings of his neurons. The arrows are almost exactly overlaid with his position. The way space is encoded in the brain is perfectly interpretable!

Dr. Sinha works with students who were born blind and have recovered their eyesight later in life. He trains them to see — this video

A cat can still walk after having its brain removed. This video was taken in the 1970s — neuroscience was crude! But astonishing: the ability to walk lives not in the brain, but in the body.

for the night is long and trips to the brain are too slow for our earthly pursuits

There are clusters of neurons in your spine called CPGs that compute motions before the information arrives in the brain. Found in frogs and flies just as well as humans, CPGs are miniature islands of mind.
